bagItProfiles.name: Private organization transfer
bagItProfiles.description: BagIt Profile for transfers of non-SFU records from private organizations to SFU Archives

tags.help: Which version of the BagIt specification describes this bag's format?
How are this bag's plain-text tag files encoded? (Hint: usually UTF-8)
E.g. "1 of 3"; use only if transferring more than 1 bag; give bag number + "of" + total bags ("N of T")
Calculated automatically by app. Represents the size of the bag transferred
Automatically supplied by the app. Represents the date the content was bagged in preparation for transfer
Automatically supplied by the app. Represents the software used to create the bag
Sender's email address; used by the Archives to follow up with any questions about the transfer
Sender's name; should be the person responsible for the content transfer and the person whom the Archives can contact with any follow-up questions about the transfer
Sender's phone number; used by the Archives to follow up with any questions about the transfer
Brief description of the contents of the transfer
Unique identifier for the transfer as assigned by the sender organization; leave blank if not applicable

Automatically calculated by the app. Represents the "octetstream sum" of the payload (contents transferred), intended for the purpose of quickly detecting incomplete bags before performing checksum validation.
Name of the sender organization whose records are being transferred

tags.defaultValue: This app collects personal information on behalf of SFU under the authority of the University Act (RSBC 1996, c.468) and the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (RSBC 1996, c.165). The personal information collected includes your name, position title, telephone number, and email address. The information is related directly to and needed by the University to verify users' authority to transfer records to the Archives and to follow up with questions about the contents of the transfer and its suitability for long-term archival preservation. As a user of an SFU Archives service, you may also be contacted in the future to participate in the evaluation of the effectiveness of the service. The information will be used by SFU Archives staff; it may be disclosed to other members of your parent organization in the context of questions about the circumstances of the transfer in the event that these later arise. If you have any questions about the collection and use of this information please contact the University Archivist and Coordinator of Information and Privacy, Paul Hebbard, pgh@sfu.ca, 778-782-2313.

Sender's job title within the organization
Accession number supplied by Archives; contact the Archives to obtain authorization and an Accession Number; can be left blank if not applicable
